alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 4:15PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko NV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River Near Elko affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Upper Humboldt...including Elko, Carlin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River Near Elko. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.7 feet, Minor flooding begins in Elko. The storm drain at 1st and Water Streets starts to back up. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:55 PM PDT Friday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:55 PM PDT Friday was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.5 feet on 06/18/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
